article.name: Integrate CYE’s Hyver with Your KSAT Console
article.title: Integrate CYE’s Hyver with Your KSAT Console
article.body:
You can integrate your CYE Hyver platform into your KSAT console. Hyver is CYE’s Cyber Risk Quantification Platform. Integrating Hyver into your KSAT console allows you to create findings based on data from phishing simulation outcomes and compliance gaps discovered during KnowBe4’s security awareness training in your organization.

Before You Connect Hyver to Your KSAT Console

Before integrating CYE’s Hyver into your KSAT console, you must find your API address and create a Reporting Event API key. Follow the steps below to do both actions.

  1. Your API address depends on where your KnowBe4 account is located. Please see the table below to find the API address for your region.
    Region Base URL
    US https://us.api.knowbe4.com
    CA https://ca.api.knowbe4.com
    EU https://eu.api.knowbe4.com
    UK https://uk.api.knowbe4.com
    DE https://de.api.knowbe4.com
  2. Log in to your KSAT console as an admin.
  3. Navigate to Account Settings in the top-right corner under your account’s email address.
  4. In Account Settings, navigate to Account Integrations.
  5. Under Account Integrations, navigate to API > Reporting API.
  6. On the Reporting API tab, click the + Create New API Token button to open the API token creation screen.
  7. Enter a name for the token, then click Create Token.
  8. Please save this API token for the below steps.

Connecting Hyver to Your KSAT Console

You can connect your Hyver platform to your KSAT console by following the steps below.

  1. Log in to your Hyver platform as an admin.
  2. Navigate to Settings > Integrations.
  3. Select the KnowBe4 tile.
  4. Enter the name for the integration.
  5. Under Authentication, enter your API address from the previous steps to the Base URL field. For example, if your KSAT account is located in the US, you would use "https://us.api.knowbe4.com".
  6. Enter the Reporting API token generated in the previous steps to the API key field.
  7. Click the Test connection button to verify that your Hyver platform can connect to the KSAT console.
  8. Click Save to save the configuration or Cancel to skip saving. When you click Save, Hyver will automatically test the connection to KSAT.

When you click Save, Hyver initiates a data synchronization with KSAT. Findings are populated in Hyver, and an engagement named Integrations with external tools is created. You can view this data on Hyver’s Findings page.

images.alt:
The image displays the **KnowBe4 APIs** management interface.

**Interface Layout and Navigation:**

1.  **Title and Context:** The page header is "**KnowBe4 APIs**." A navigational link, "← Back to Account Settings," is positioned in the upper right corner.
2.  **API Type Selection:** Two tab controls are available for filtering API access: "**Reporting API**" (currently selected/active) and "**User Event API**" (inactive).
3.  **Actions and Documentation:** Located above the data grid, a text link directs users to "Reference Documentation." The primary Call to Action (CTA), marked by the annotation '6', is a blue button labeled "**+ Create New API Token**."

**Data Grid (API Token List):**

A table lists generated API tokens with the following columns:

*   **Key:** (Value is obfuscated/redacted, contains an information tooltip icon).
*   **Name:** (Value is obfuscated/redacted).
*   **Generated By:** (Value is an obfuscated email address ending in `.com`).
*   **Generated On:** Date stamp (e.g., `09/01/2024`).
*   **Status:** Indicated by a green checkmark icon (denoting active status).
*   **Actions:** A dropdown caret menu for token management.

The table summary indicates: "Displaying all 1 rows."
images.context:
rong>API > Reporting API.
On the Reporting API tab, click the + Create New API Token button to open

images.alt:
This image depicts the user interface for configuring and creating a new API token. The screen is titled **"Create New API Token,"** with a navigational link in the upper right corner labeled **"← Back to Reporting API Tokens."**

The configuration form contains the following labeled fields and UI components:

1.  **Name:**
    *   A text input field is displayed in an **error state**, indicated by a red/pink border.
    *   The placeholder text within the field is "Name."
    *   A validation message below the input reads: **"This field cannot be empty."**
    *   The input field includes two small icons on the right edge (an arrow and an information 'i' icon).

2.  **Generated By:**
    *   A read-only field displaying the identity of the generator (an obfuscated email address ending in ".com").

3.  **Status:**
    *   The current operational status is displayed as **"Enabled,"** accompanied by a green checkmark icon.
    *   A dark gray button labeled **"Disable"** is presented, allowing the user to change the token's active status.

The primary action button for form submission is a solid blue button labeled **"Create Token."**
images.context: Enter a name for the token, then click Create Token.

images.alt:
This technical description details the interface for configuring a KnowBe4 integration within the CYE Hyver platform.

**Context and Navigation:**
The application header displays the platform name "CYE Hyver" and the current navigation path "Organization | Integration." The user context is "BarCompany." A vertical sidebar labeled "Settings menu" includes navigation options such as "User profile," "Account & Two-factor authentication," and "Integrations" (the likely active context).

**Integration Configuration Pane:**
The main content area is titled "KnowBe4 integration," with a link to navigate back labeled "< All integrations." The main instruction text is: "Complete the following fields to configure the authentication for the KnowBe4 integration."

**Input Fields and Authentication Details:**
The configuration form requires the following mandatory fields:

1.  **Integration name\***: An input field with the placeholder "Add integration name."
2.  **1. Authentication** (Section Header):
    *   **Base URL\***: A pre-populated input field displaying `https://us.api.knowbe4.com`.
    *   **API key\***: A masked input field for entering sensitive credentials.

A primary action button, labeled **"Test connection"** (dark blue/black), is available below the input fields to verify the entered authentication credentials.

images.alt:
This image depicts the user interface of the "Findings" section within a software application identified as "CYE Hyver."

**I. Application Header and Navigation:**

*   **Header:** Displays the application logo and name "CYE Hyver."
*   **Active Context:** The main navigation indicates the user is in the "Organization" section, viewing "Findings."
*   **Sidebar (Vertical Navigation):** A standard navigation pane is visible on the left, grouped by sections: "INDUSTRY," "RISK," "MITIGATE," and "REMEDIATE." The current page is indicated by the blue highlighted icon (document/list icon) under the "REMEDIATE" section.

**II. Main Content Area – Overview and Controls:**

*   **Summary Metric:** A large display shows "0 New findings."
*   **View Selector:** A filter label displays "View: **All findings**."
*   **Action Bar:** Contains two primary input controls:
    1.  A dropdown filter labeled "Filters."
    2.  A search bar placeholder labeled "Search."

**III. Data Table (Findings List):**

The main area is dominated by a sortable, filterable list of findings. All visible rows are prefixed with a vertical red severity/status indicator bar.

*   **Table Header Columns:**
    *   A global selection checkbox.
    *   Dropdown/Action menu column (unlabeled).
    *   **Severity** (Currently sorted descending, indicated by a down arrow).
    *   **Recommended p...** (Partial label, currently sorted ascending, indicated by an up arrow).
    *   **Critical to block**.

*   **Data Rows (Visible Examples):**
    *   **Row 1 (Hover State):** Highlighted in blue, indicating hover or selection. Data fields include an unchecked checkbox, action menu icon, "Critical," "1," and "No." A hand cursor icon confirms the hover state over the "No" cell in the "Critical to block" column.
    *   **Row 2:** "Critical," "2," "No."
    *   **Row 3:** "High," "3," "No."
    *   **Row 4:** "High," "4," "No."
    *   **Row 5:** "High," "5," "No."
images.context: You can view this data on Hyver’s Findings page.
